snippet: Inspired by a personal experience, a businessman began delving into the practices of the mortgage industry, including Fannie Mae. His findings have been prescient.
abstract: Businessman Nye Lavalle, after losing a family home to foreclosure under what he thought were questionable circumstances, began delving into practices of the mortgage industry, including those of Fannie Mae, in 2003; in hindsight, what he found looks like a blueprint of the foreclosure crisis; he corresponded with Fannie Mae about abusive foreclosure practices, but the agency never took any serious action.
